1991.definition: Involuntary commitment (inpatient) is prohibitive for firearm purchase/possession
Firearm purchase/possession prohibited if person deemed by court to be danger to oneself or others
Firearm purchase/possession is prohibited for some people with alcoholism
State dealer license required for handgun sales
Reporting of sales records to the state required for licensed dealers for handgun sales
State is not required to purge sales records for at least 60 days after purchase
Waiting period is required on all handgun purchases from dealers
No gun carrying on elementary school property, including concealed weapons permittees
Permit required to carry concealed weapons
Ban on junk guns (sometimes called "Saturday night specials")
No law provides blanket immunity to gun manufacturers or prohibits state or local lawsuits against gun manufacturers

Purchase of long guns from licensed dealers and private sellers restricted to age 18 and older

Ammunition sales not allowed to persons under age 21 for handguns

State is not required to purge background check records for at least 60 days

Purchase of long guns from licensed dealers and private sellers restricted to age 18 and older
No possession of handguns until age 21
Ammunition sales not allowed to persons under age 18 for any type of ammunition (all firearms)
Ammunition sales not allowed to persons under age 21 for handguns
Universal background check required at point of transfer for handguns
Background checks required for purchase of handguns at gun shows at point of purchase
Background checks conducted through permit requirement for all handgun sales (or universal background checks)
State is not required to purge background check records for at least 60 days
Background checks for gun sales or permits have more than a three-day limit in which they must be completed
State conducts separate background checks, beyond the federal NICS check, for handguns
Waiting period is required on all handgun purchases from dealers
Assault weapons sales ban beyond just assault pistols
Assault weapons included in a list of banned weapons
Transfer of grandfathered weapons is prohibited
Ban on large capacity magazines beyond just ammunition for pistols
Ban includes a 10-round limit (not a 15 or higher round limit)
One handgun per month with no or limited exceptions
No gun carrying on elementary school property, including concealed weapons permittees
Permit required to carry concealed weapons
"May issue" state
Applicants are required to make a heightened showing to obtain a concealed carry permit
Concealed carry permit process requires a background check
No stand your ground law
State has a law that requires review of personalized gun technology
Safety lock required for handguns sold through dealers
Criminal liability for negligent storage of guns, regardless of whether child actually gains access
Criminal liability for negligent storage of guns if child gains access
Criminal liability for negligent storage of guns if child uses or carries the gun
Criminal liability for negligent storage applies regardless of whether gun is loaded or unloaded
Criminal liability applies to children less than 16 years old
Criminal liability applies to children less than 14 years old
Ban on junk guns (sometimes called "Saturday night specials")
No law provides blanket immunity to gun manufacturers or prohibits state or local lawsuits against gun manufacturers
State law automatically prohibits domestic violence-related restraining order (DVRO) subjects from possessing firearms
State law requires DVRO subjects to surrender their firearms
No additional finding is required before the firearm surrender provisions apply
A stalking conviction is prohibitive for firearm possession
